message: https://github.com/dreid/emacs-config  It's an attempt at minimal.  All external package dependencies are fetched using el-get.
Also I find el-get recipes very intuitive.  el-get's main page also gave way more information that package.el's.
@dreid why el-get rather than package.el?
But as I've said, there is nothing to prevent me from using the two together.  el-get just seemed like less work at the exact instance I rewrote my 10 year old emacs configs.
When I first looked at them both el-get had more recipes for stuff I cared about and el-get can also use elpa as a source.
http://marmalade-repo.org/  -- fwiw
or, you could define this macro
a relatively new emacsen. I've got a comfy set up. I open to suggestions like `you're doing it wrong` github.com/softprops/em
I'm giddy for pretty-mode
@softprops You should likely not be checking in your *.elc files
also, instead of

(add-to-list 'auto-mode-alist '("\\.js$" . js2-mode))
(add-to-list 'auto-mode-alist '("\\.json$" . js-mode))
you can do...
(add-to-list 'auto-mode-alist '(("\\.js$" . js2-mode) ("\\.json$" . js-mode)))
errr.
(setq auto-mode-alist (append '(("\\.js$" . js2-mode) ("\\.json$" . js-mode)))
(setq auto-mode-alist (append ...)) will kill the original auto-mode-alist, so that's not good.
You could however do (setq auto-mode-alist (append '(("\\.js$" . js2-mode)) '(("\\.json$" . js-mode)) auto-mode-alist))
yea, that's what I have on mine.
Just a pain in the ass to type here.
http://i.imgur.com/p0hEh.png
bah!
http://i.imgur.com/C7Faf.png
/me grumbles at imagemagick

(defmacro add-all-to-list (l &rest rest)
  (let ((adds (mapcar (lambda (x)
                        `(add-to-list l ,x))
                      rest)))
    `(progn ,@adds)))
and then do (add-all-to-list auto-mode-alist '("\\.js$" . js2-mode) '("\\.json$" . js-mode))
which will expand into an (add-to-list ...) call for each argument
I should really attempt to figure out macros one of these days.....
shows: (progn (add-to-list l (quote (hello))) (add-to-list l (quote (world))))
and use: (add-all-to-list 'ttt 'hello 'world)
the concept is simple. it's a program that writes other programs at compile time.
the great thing is that you can use all the other stuff defined, like mapcar in this example to construct the forms you want to output.
if you do (setq ttt '()) first...
(macroexpand '(add-all-to-list ttt '(hello) '(world)))
it'd probably be better to define add-all-to-list as a function in all honesty, but whatever
which, you could define:

(defun add-all-to-list (l &rest rest)
  (dolist (elt rest l)
    (add-to-list l elt)))
lisp is the cat's meow. So powerful
I get the concept of macros.. just haven't written one before (or rather don't know when I should write one)
Clearly convore needs to support auto embedding of gists.  Reading your non indented non-syntax-highlighted elisp is making my head hurt.
@dreid *excellent* idea.
I totally said that first ;)
oh. my bad.

:-P no worries. not like it actually matters.
